creator: bjlockie

title: Indexing nightmare, constantly trying to index hundreds of thousands of messages
content:
I've been using TB since the beginning, so like 20 years now, congrats! (to me ðŸ˜œ) Now IÂ have at least 10 accounts and hundreds of folders and everything was fine until I started archiving some old messages in one account, and TBÂ began creating new archive folders like YYYY/YYYY-MM which were being included in the Global Search/indexer by default. So I went to the properties of each folder and unchecked the option to include it in the Global Search results. I could see in the Activity Monitor the indexing of that folder would stop and go on to the next one, until I disabled all 12. Now TB is indexing over 100,000 messages but it doesn't say what folder these are in, I can't seem to find it.

What I did find is the global-messages-db.sqlite database which, after closing TB, I made a backup of, then I found the folderLocations table with hundreds of rows and the IndexingPriority column which had various values of: -1, 20, 40, 50, and 60. I set them all to -1 and TB is still trying to index over 100,000 messages somewhere. Where? and how to stop its madness?!
creator: scarlion

title: Lost email account
content: I was having trouble with the my supplier email address, and they asked me to reset it. It then seemed to have disappeared so I set up a new account. Suddenly I ended up with 2 accounts with the same emails. After agonising over whether or not I should remove it, IU removed what I thought was the duplicate account. I find I Have removed the first account, and the second one is there but has no emails. I keep everything! Now I have nothing. Is there a way to recover it?
creator: margaretcmurray

title: downloading emails in Thunderbird
content: Suddenly yesterday afternoon I became unable to download emails to Thunderbird (I can still do it in talktalk). I get a message "Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough disc space to copy the mailbox." I have checked there is plenty of disc space. What can I do to get the system working again? I suspect Thunderbird downloaded an update yesterday.

title: downloading emails in Thunderbird
content: In answer to question from Chris, my AV software is AVG free version.

title: Sending using 115.8.1 unreliable
content:
After upgrading to 115.8.1 , Tbird will only send immediately after startup, otherwise I get the choice to Save (draft) or abandon.

I have tried changing the various TLS options, and now continue to use the ones that have always historically worked.

What is causing this. Rather inconvenient

title: Loading private key after new Thgunderbird nstallation is not posssible
content: I had a crash in Kubuntu 22.04 with Thunderbird (up to date 115, German language). I set a Master password for Thunderbird. I installed then Kubuntu and Thunderbird again and Thunderbird without Master Password. I have a backup of the private email key (*-secret.asc exported from Thunderbird!), but it is not possible to import the private key. All I get is â€žFailure File can not be importedâ€œ. What is the problem and how to solve it? I did new installations (without master password) before and it worked. Itâ€™s a really big big problem for the email system if the (Backup) keys can not be imported after crashes or new installation of the system.
creator: DJWalter

title: Deleted emails
content: Hello Two days ago when I deleted an email from my 'inbox' and from my 'Sent' folder they have been permanently deleted as the Trask or Bin folder is no longer showing. How can I reinstall it please? Thank you in anticipation. Ian

title: An "expert" helped me add Tbird to a new desktop, importing an existing working installation from my laptop.  The new Tbird wants my password but rejects the one saved during the install
content: This "friend" of mine computer expert helped me set up a new second computer with a migrated Tbird installation. Now when I try to open this Tbird on my new desktop it wants my password but rejects the one saved during the installation; saying "Login to server mobile.charter.net with username jleek001@san.rr.com failed" The password it shows existing for this under Settings/Saved Logins is oddly the same as the password saved on my laptop for bigdipper@san.rr.com. The laptop still runs its original Tbird just fine with the 2 email addresses. On this new desktop installation that won't run, I could change the password (to match the working laptop version) or remove it. What might be the result of either? (LaterI will copy the profile over from the laptop)
creator: john.leek

title: Emojis in the Subject line
content:
Whenever I add an emoji from the list to a message, it does not appear where my cursor is, it appears in the Subject line. It wasn't always like this, but I don't remember which update brought it on. Is there a fix for it? Usually subsequent emojis go where I tell them to, but the first one never does.

I know that in the great scheme of things, this is a pretty trivial problem, but it's a little irritation every time I add an emoji to a message. Anyone else have this happen? Or have a solution? Thanks!
creator: Lunaea

title: Any way to change the default welcome page to acknowledge my payment?
content:
I contribute monthly to Thunderbird, is there any way to disable the default page asking for donations?

Or, I guess is there some way to edit that default page when launching Thunderbird?
